notes.text:
An update for qemu-kvm-rhev is now available for Red Hat OpenStack Platform 10.0 (Newton), Red Hat OpenStack Platform 13.0 (Queens), and Red Hat OpenStack Platform 14.0 (Rocky).

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine) is a full virtualization solution for Linux on a variety of architectures. The qemu-kvm-rhev packages provide the user-space component for running virtual machines that use KVM in environments managed by Red Hat products.

Security Fix(es):

* QEMU: slirp: heap buffer overflow in tcp_emu() (CVE-2019-6778)

* QEMU: rtl8139: integer overflow leads to buffer overflow (CVE-2018-17958)

* QEMU: net: ignore packets with large size (CVE-2018-17963)

* QEMU: seccomp: blacklist is not applied to all threads (CVE-2018-15746)

* QEMU: scsi-generic: possible OOB access while handling inquiry request (CVE-2019-6501)

* QEMU: slirp: information leakage in tcp_emu() due to uninitialized stack variables (CVE-2019-9824)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* Update qemu-kvm-rhev for RHEL 7.7 compatibility [OSP-14] (BZ#1728358)

* Update qemu-kvm-rhev for RHEL 7.7 compatibility [OSP-13] (BZ#1728359)

* Update qemu-kvm-rhev for RHEL 7.7 compatibility [OSP-10] (BZ#1728360)

notes.text: qemu-seccomp.c in QEMU might allow local OS guest users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) by leveraging mishandling of the seccomp policy for threads other than the main thread.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: QEMU: seccomp: blacklist is not applied to all threads
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing this update, shut down all running virtual machines. Once all virtual machines have shut down, start them again for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: QEMU: seccomp: blacklist is not applied to all threads

notes.text: An integer overflow issue was found in the RTL8139 NIC emulation in QEMU. It could occur while receiving packets over the network if the size value is greater than INT_MAX. Such overflow would lead to stack buffer overflow issue. A user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process, resulting in DoS scenario.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: QEMU: rtl8139: integer overflow leads to buffer overflow

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

After installing this update, shut down all running virtual machines. Once all virtual machines have shut down, start them again for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: QEMU: rtl8139: integer overflow leads to buffer overflow

notes.text: A potential integer overflow issue was found in the networking back-end of QEMU. It could occur while receiving packets, because it accepted packets with large size value. Such overflow could lead to OOB buffer access issue. A user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process resulting in DoS.

notes.text: In QEMU 3.1, scsi_handle_inquiry_reply in hw/scsi/scsi-generic.c allows out-of-bounds write and read operations.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: QEMU: scsi-generic: possible OOB access while handling inquiry request

notes.text: A heap buffer overflow issue was found in the SLiRP networking implementation of the QEMU emulator. It occurs in tcp_emu() routine while emulating the Identification protocol and copying message data to a socket buffer. A user or process could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process on the host resulting in a DoS or potentially executing arbitrary code with privileges of the QEMU process.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: QEMU: slirp: heap buffer overflow in tcp_emu()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenStack Platform:                                                                                                                 
This flaw impacts KVM user-mode or SLIRP networking, which is not used in Red Hat OpenStack. Updating is recommended, however Red Hat OpenStack installs are not vulnerable to the described flaw due to the vulnerable feature not being used.

notes.text: tcp_emu in slirp/tcp_subr.c (aka slirp/src/tcp_subr.c) in QEMU 3.0.0 uses uninitialized data in an snprintf call, leading to Information disclosure.
